HEADING: Enable this plugin in order to play music when Volumio starts
AUTOSTART_SETTINGS_DESC: Configure automatic playback when Volumio starts.
AUTOSTART_SAVEFROMLASTPOS_DOC: Play from the last position in the queue before Volumio was shutdown. Otherwise playback starts from the beginning of the queue.
AUTOSTART_DELAY_DOC: Additional delay after system ready and volume is set. Increase if your audio hardware needs extra time to initialize.
VOLUME_SETTINGS_DESC: Set a specific volume level when playback starts. Volume is applied after system ready, before the additional delay.
VOLUME_ENABLED_DOC: When enabled, volume will be set to the specified level before playback starts.
VOLUME_LEVEL_DOC: Volume level to set at startup. Value must be between 0 and 100. Note: This may not work if mixer is set to None.
POLLING_SETTINGS_DESC: Controls how the plugin waits for Volumio to fully initialize before starting playback. Slower hardware like Raspberry Pi Zero may need longer timeouts.
SHOW_POLLING_SETTINGS_DOC: Toggle to reveal timing configuration. Default wait time is 5 minutes (5000ms x 60 attempts).
POLLING_INTERVAL_DOC: How often to check if system is ready. Default: 5000ms (5 seconds).
MAX_POLLING_ATTEMPTS_DOC: Maximum number of checks before timeout. Default: 60 attempts.
